name: veriloghdl
description: Verilog-HDL/SystemVerilog/Bluespec SystemVerilog support for VS Code

verilog.ctags.path.markdownDescription: A path to the Ctags binary. Specify the binary name if it's in your `PATH`, or provide an absolute path to the executable.

verilog.formatting.verilogFormat.path.markdownDescription: A path to the verilog-format binary.

verilog.formatting.verilogFormat.setting.markdownDescription: A path to the verilog-format settings file.

verilog.formatting.iStyleVerilogFormatte.markdownDescription: A path to the iStyle Verilog Formatter binary.
Add custom arguments to iStyle Verilog Formatter for formatting.

verilog.formatting.veribleVerilogFormatt.markdownDescription: A path to the verible-verilog-format binary.
Add custom arguments to verible-verilog-format for formatting.

verilog.linting.path.markdownDescription: Path to your installation of linter if it isn't already present in your `PATH` environment variable.

verilog.linting.iverilog.arguments.markdownDescription: Add Icarus Verilog arguments here (like macros). They will be added to Icarus Verilog while linting (The command `-t null` will be added by the linter by default).

verilog.linting.iverilog.includePath.markdownDescription: A list of directory paths to use while Icarus Verilog linting. All the paths are passed as arguments `-I <directory_path>`. Paths can be specified either an absolute or a relative to the workspace directory.

enumDescriptions: IEEE1364-1995, specified by -g1995 option in Icarus Verilog
IEEE1364-2001, specified by -g2001 option in Icarus Verilog
IEEE1364-2005, specified by -g2005 option in Icarus Verilog
verilog.linting.iverilog.verilogHDL.stan.markdownDescription: Select the standard rule to be used when Icarus Verilog linting for Verilog-HDL files.

enumDescriptions: IEEE1800-2005, specified by -g2005-sv option in Icarus Verilog
IEEE1800-2009, specified by -g2009 option in Icarus Verilog
IEEE1800-2012, specified by -g2012 option in Icarus Verilog
verilog.linting.iverilog.systemVerilog.s.markdownDescription: Select the standard rule to be used when Icarus Verilog linting for SystemVerilog files.

verilog.linting.iverilog.runAtFileLocati.markdownDescription: If enabled, Icarus Verilog will be run at the file location for linting. Else it will be run at workspace folder.

verilog.linting.modelsim.runAtFileLocati.markdownDescription: If enabled, Modelsim will be run at the file location for linting. Else it will be run at workspace folder.

verilog.linting.modelsim.arguments.markdownDescription: Add Modelsim arguments here. They will be added to Modelsim while linting.

verilog.linting.slang.arguments.markdownDescription: Add Slang arguments here (like macros). They will be added to Slang while linting (The command `-I=<document folder>` will be added by the linter by default).

verilog.linting.slang.includePath.markdownDescription: A list of directory paths to use while Slang linting.

verilog.linting.slang.runAtFileLocation.markdownDescription: If enabled, Slang will be run at the file location for linting. Else it will be run at workspace folder.

verilog.linting.slang.useWSL.markdownDescription: Run verilator under WSL. Paths generated automatically by the extension (the path to the Verilog file as well as the auto-generated document folder for `-I` ) are translated to WSL paths using the `wslpath` program. Any other paths you specify in `verilog.linting.includePath.arguments`

verilog.linting.verilator.arguments.markdownDescription: Add Verilator arguments here (like macros or `-Wall`). They will be added to Verilator while linting (The command `--lint-only -I<document folder>` will be added by the linter by default).

verilog.linting.verilator.includePath.markdownDescription: A list of directory paths to use while Verilator linting. All the paths are passed as arguments `-I<directory_path>`. Paths can be specified either an absolute or a relative to the workspace directory.

verilog.linting.verilator.runAtFileLocat.markdownDescription: If enabled, Verilator will be run at the file location for linting. Else it will be run at workspace folder.

verilog.linting.verilator.useWSL.markdownDescription: Run verilator under WSL (use `apg-get install verilator` to install). Paths generated automatically by the extension (the path to the Verilog file as well as the auto-generated document folder for `-I` ) are translated to WSL paths using the `wslpath` program. Any other paths you specify in `verilog.linting.verilator.arguments` must be manually converted.

verilog.linting.veribleVerilogLint.argum.markdownDescription: Add verible-verilog-lint arguments here. They will be added to verible-verilog-lint while linting.

verilog.linting.veribleVerilogLint.runAt.markdownDescription: If enabled, verible-verilog-lint will be run at the file location for linting. Else it will be run at workspace folder.

verilog.linting.xvlog.arguments.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments to Xilinx xvlog for linting, like `-Wall` . The argument `--nolog` will be added by the linter automatically.

verilog.linting.xvlog.includePath.markdownDescription: A list of directory paths to use while Xilinx xvlog linting. All the paths are passed as arguments `-i <directory_path>`. Paths can be specified either an absolute or a relative to the workspace directory.

verilog.languageServer.svls.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable svls Language Server for SystemVerilog.

verilog.languageServer.svls.path.markdownDescription: A path to the Svls Language Server binary.

verilog.languageServer.svls.svlintTomlPa.markdownDescription: [Experimental] Override the .toml configuration file to be used by svlint. Sets the `SVLINT_CONFIG` environment variable. When not set svlint searches for `.svlint.toml` within the Workspace folder.
verilog.languageServer.svls.svlintTomlPa.patternErrorMessage: Must be a path to a .toml file

verilog.languageServer.svls.arguments.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments for the Svls Language Server.

verilog.languageServer.veridian.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable veridian Language Server for SystemVerilog.

verilog.languageServer.veridian.path.markdownDescription: A path to the Veridian Language Server binary.

verilog.languageServer.veridian.argument.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments for the HDL Checker Veridian Language Server.

verilog.languageServer.hdlChecker.enable.markdownDescription: Enable HDL Checker Language Server for Verilog-HDL, SystemVerilog, and VHDL.

verilog.languageServer.hdlChecker.path.markdownDescription: A path to the HDL Checker Language Server binary.

verilog.languageServer.hdlChecker.argume.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments for the HDL Checker Language Server.

verilog.languageServer.veribleVerilogLs..markdownDescription: Enable verible-verilog-ls Language Server for SystemVerilog.
A path to the verible-verilog-ls Language Server binary.
Add custom arguments for the verible-verilog-ls Language Server.

verilog.languageServer.tclsp.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable tclsp Language Server for Tcl/SDC/XDC/UPF.

verilog.languageServer.tclsp.path.markdownDescription: A path to the tclsp Language Server binary.

verilog.languageServer.tclsp.arguments.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments for the tclsp Language Server.

verilog.languageServer.tclsp.configPath.markdownDescription: Optional path to a tclint config file. Absolute paths are recommended; relative paths are resolved per workspace root.

verilog.languageServer.rustHdl.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable vhdl_ls Language Server for VHDL.

verilog.languageServer.rustHdl.path.markdownDescription: A path to the vhdl_ls Language Server binary.

verilog.languageServer.rustHdl.arguments.markdownDescription: Add custom arguments for the vhdl_ls Language Server.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
